Synopsis: Stops the stopwatch and returns the elapsed time in a specified format.
Description: The Stop-TimeLog function stops the provided stopwatch and returns the elapsed time in a specified format. The function can output the elapsed time as a single string or an array of days, hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds.

Examples.Title: EXAMPLE 1
Examples.Code:
$stopwatch = [System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch]::StartNew()
# Perform some operations
Stop-TimeLog -Time $stopwatch
# Output: "0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes, 5 seconds, 123 milliseconds"

Examples.Title: EXAMPLE 2
Examples.Code:
$stopwatch = [System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch]::StartNew()
# Perform some operations
Stop-TimeLog -Time $stopwatch -Option Array
# Output: ["0 days", "0 hours", "0 minutes", "5 seconds", "123 milliseconds"]
